data.id: Contractual risks are linked to existing market positions in securities or derivatives, lending products, internal and external performance contracts

children.id: Risks linked to underwritten liabilities for any of the defined types of insurance policies
Risks linked to the underwriting of life insurance policies, such as deviations from standard mortality rates or lapses and revisions to policies
Risks linked to the underwriting of health insurance policies, such as deviations from standard sickness rates or lapses and revisions to policies
Risks linked to the underwriting of motor (car) insurance policies, such as deviations from standard claim rates or lapses and revisions to policies
Risks linked to the underwriting of property insurance policies, such as deviations from standard claim rates or lapses and revisions to policies
Risks linked to the underwriting of liability insurance policies, such as deviations from standard claim rates or lapses and revisions to policies
Risks linked to traded markets positions or banking book positions affected by market price level, volatility, correlations or liquidity
Risks linked to the level and volatility of a given market
Risks linked to the correlation (dependency) of price levels in different markets
The risk of wide(r) bid/ask spreads or even complete market dislocation (jumpt risk)
Valuation risk applies to illiquid products which may require unobservable and model based parameters for marking-to-market
Hedging risk applies to illiquid products when certain elements of market risk are to hedged away on the basis of model derived hedges. Includes basis risk
Risks arising from credit events (default, bankruptcy) associated with a legal entity reneging on its contractual obligations (for payment)
The risk of a credit event. Typically a credit term structure. Regulatory credit models simplify to 1-yr estimate
The risk that the exposure at default may be differ from current exposure
Uncertainty about the loss given a credit event (complementary to recovery risk)
Uncertainty about joint default events (correlation, dependency or contagion)
Risks in products with optional features (non-linear payoffs)
The risk that clients who borrowed funds will prepay these funds earlier than expected due to a reduction in prevailing interest rates
The risk that clients with credit lines will draw on these at amounts different than expected due to their individual or market circumstances
Risks linked to agreements with current employees and liabilities to these previously employed
The risk of adverse developments to the firms human resource pool (key person risk / defections, under-performance)
The risk of unexpected required contributions to employee pension funds that cannot meet their required solvency standard on standalone basis

data.id: The Business Risks category contains all non-contractual risks that threaten the firms business plan objectives

children.id: Operational risk concerns threats to the normal operations of the firm
The risk of unexpected loss as the result of physical damage to the firms assets or failure of its systems
The risk of loss as a result of poor or erroneous execution of regular business tasks
The risk of unexpected loss as the result of fraudulent action of persons internal to the firm
The risk of unexpected loss as the result of fraudulent action of persons external to the firm
The risk of unexpected loss as the result of employment practices followed by the firm which may not meet applicable laws and standards
Revenue risk covers all risks pertaining to the ability to persist or grow profitable business operations
The risk that product volumes (as relative market share) will deviate from business plan or budget, leading to unexpectedly lower revenues
The risk of reduction in the wider market demand for the firms product and services as a result of factors external to the firm or its competitors
The risk of lower profitability versus the business plan, as the result of tighter pricing (does not include funding cost component)
The risk of lower profitability versus the business plan as the result of higher origination costs due to external or internal factors
The risk that forward looking projects that modify the firms business plan fail to deliver the expected return versus investment
The funding risk category covers risks linked to uncertainty around the availability of future external funds for financing operations
The risk of being unable to refinance via short term deposits in sufficient amounts or reasonable terms
The risk of sudden volume reductions in deposits, or that required deposit rates to maintain volumes will rise unexpectedly in response to market or firm events
Franchise risk captures the impact of external or internal risk factors on the perceived long term franchise value of the firm
The risk of losses arising from an unintentional or negligent failure to meet professional (legal, fiduciary) obligations to clients, counterparties or employees
The risk that competitors develop drastically alternative business models for delivering similar goods or services
The risk that the broader environment in which the firm operates will develop in directions adverse to the firms business plan. Includes Regulatory Risk
